instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>  is sitting at 0.915V
threads.message: hello guys ... Please I need help on this one .. have got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> , however its not completely missing but sitting at 0.9V .... Other rails other than the S4 are present . any hint guys ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>  is sitting at 0.915V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> enables S3 state!
So check other previous signals, if you do no get into S4 yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>  is sitting at 0.915V
threads.message: Thank you for your response ... Resolved
